reg:regulation.reg:title:
Tunnel Transportation
of Dangerous Goods Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: means of containment has the same meaning as in the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992 (Canada);
means of transport has the same meaning as in the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Act, 1992 (Canada);

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not transport any means of containment in a prohibited area at any time when section 4.15 of the Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations, SOR/2001-286, requires that a placard, within the meaning of that regulation, be displayed on the means of containment.
Despite subsection (1), a person may transport a means of containment in a prohibited area at a time referred to in subsection (1) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person does so in accordance with a written permit issued by the minister, and
the permit is carried in the means of transport transporting the means of containment when it is in the prohibited area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may issue a permit for the purposes of subsection (2) if the minister is satisfied that no suitable alternative route exists, and may impose any terms and conditions that the minister considers appropriate.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Transportation Act, S.B.C. 2004, c. 44, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 90]
